etymologies: mid 18th century: from Scottish Gaelic and Irish crotal, crotan

definitions: a common lichen found on rocks, used in Scotland to make a golden-brown or reddish-brown dye for staining wool for making tweed.

notes.text: Parmelia saxatilis (order Parmeliales) and other species

shortDefinitions: common lichen found on rocks, used in Scotland to make golden-brown or reddish-brown dye for staining wool for making tweed
